siteSettings.title: Kinloch Nelson - Fingerstyle Guitar
siteSettings.description: Virtuosic fingerstyle guitarist from Rochester, NY, blending classical technique with jazz sensibilities through American roots, blues, and contemporary music.

seoSettings.metaTitle: Kinloch Nelson - Fingerstyle Guitar | Rochester, NY 14692
seoSettings.metaDescription: Virtuosic fingerstyle guitarist from Rochester, NY, blending classical technique with jazz sensibilities. Fingerstyle Guitar, Finger Picking.

biography.name: Kinloch Nelson
biography.shortBio: A virtuosic fingerstyle guitarist whose performances showcase the technical mastery of a classical musician combined with the interpretive sensibility of a contemporary artist.
fullBio: Kinloch Nelson's journey with the guitar began in the rich musical landscape of the late 1960s, a time of incredible innovation in both classical and popular music. His early recordings, captured in "Partly On Time: Recordings, 1968-1970," document the development of a unique voice in fingerstyle guitar.

Drawing inspiration from classical guitar traditions while embracing the improvisational spirit of jazz, Nelson developed an approach that seamlessly weaves together disparate musical elements. His technique combines the precision of classical training with the emotional expression found in blues and folk traditions.

Based in Rochester, New York, Nelson has maintained a connection to the region's rich musical heritage while developing an internationally recognized style that has influenced generations of fingerstyle guitarists.
achievements: Critical acclaim from Portland Press Herald
Recognition from Just Jazz Magazine and City Newspaper
Decades of teaching and performance excellence

testimonials.quote: Kinloch Nelson plays with the virtuosity of a classical master and the sensibility of a pop performer.
testimonials.author: Music Critic

testimonials.quote: Kinloch Nelson is a gifted performer and a brilliant arranger who can do wonders with virtually any song.
testimonials.author: Dave Walker

testimonials.quote: Nelson's playing is a journey through American roots, jazz, country, blues, classical...
testimonials.author: Frank De Blase

testimonials.quote: A seemingly effortless exhibition of inspirational skills, full of surprises...
testimonials.author: Fan Review

recordings.title: Partly On Time: Recordings, 1968-1970
recordings.description: A collection of early recordings showcasing the development of fingerstyle guitar techniques during a pivotal period in American music. These recordings capture the evolution of Kinloch Nelson's unique approach to the guitar.

links.title: Fretboard Journal Podcast
links.description: Featured interview and performance on the acclaimed guitar podcast

links.title: Acoustic Guitar Magazine Sessions
links.description: Studio session and interview with premier acoustic guitar publication

links.title: Dynamic Recording Studios
links.description: Professional recording studio where many of Kinloch's recordings were made

links.title: YouTube Channel
links.description: Complete video collection of performances and tutorials

workshops.title: Private Guitar Instruction
workshops.description: One-on-one lessons tailored to your skill level and musical interests, focusing on fingerstyle technique, arrangement skills, and musical expression. Learn the techniques behind the recordings and performances.

workshops.title: Fingerstyle Guitar Workshop
workshops.description: Small group workshops covering fundamental fingerstyle techniques, basic arrangements, and performance skills. Learn the approaches used in 'Partly On Time: Recordings, 1968-1970' and other works.

workshops.title: Advanced Arrangement Masterclass
workshops.description: Intensive masterclass for experienced players focusing on advanced arrangement techniques, jazz harmony integration, and performance interpretation. Explore the methods behind arrangements like 'Song For My Father' and 'Song of India'.

performances.title: Evening of Fingerstyle Guitar
performances.description: An intimate evening featuring original compositions and innovative arrangements, including selections from 'Partly On Time: Recordings, 1968-1970'.

performances.title: Jazz & Blues Showcase
performances.description: Classic jazz standards and blues interpreted through fingerstyle technique, featuring arrangements like 'Song For My Father'.
